bill_title: revise certain provisions concerning the presumption of legitimacy of children born or conceived in wedlock.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions concerning the presumption of legitimacy of children born or conceived in wedlock. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 25-8-57 be amended to read as follows: 25-8-57. Any child born in wedlock, or born within ten months after dissolution of the marriage, is presumed legitimate to that marriage even if the marriage is subsequently declared to be null and void, or subsequently dissolved by divorce. This rebuttable This presumption of legitimacy can only be disputed by is rebutted if the husband or wife, or a descendant of one or both of them, denies the presumption of legitimacy in a sworn and notarized affidavit. Section 2. That chapter 25-8 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If the presumption of legitimacy provided for in § 25-8-57 is rebutted pursuant to the provisions of section 1 of this Act, the birth certificate of the child may not bear the name of any person as the father of the child unless paternity is established by other provisions of chapter 25-8 or until the paternity of the child is judicially determined. 135 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.075 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
